Name: Carroll County Cake Swap
Description:
A card game for baking perfectionists and those who like to sabotage them.

Put on your apron and grab your mixing bowls as you vie for ribbons in the cake decorating contest at the Carroll County Fair. Create the tallest, most beautiful cakes by stacking layer upon layer of frosted sweetness. Will you go slow and steady to create a few cakes with extreme precision? Or rush to submit your cakes ahead of the competition? Draw or draft cards to build cakes up to five layers tall. Elbow your opponents to get the types of cake (chocolate or vanilla) and frosting flavors (five fruits, plus a wild) you need to win ribbons in six categories. Only one player may win each ribbon, so you’ll have to swipe, swap, and squeeze your way to victory. Some ribbons are worth more than others. Choose carefully which ones you go for in this race to outmaneuver other contestants.

Name: Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018
Description:
Brettspiel Adventskalender 2018 is pretty much what the name says it is: A board game advent calendar for 2018 that contains 25 small expansions or accessories for 25 different games from different publishers. The game rules for each item are included, but they will also be posted separately on the publisher's website on each day from December 1st to 24th.

SPOILER: List of games --> https://frostedgames.de/pm-ak18/2018/08/
Families: Misc: Advent / Christmas / Jule calendar game

Name: Gameception: Sneak Geek
Description: Gameception: Sneak Geek is a 15 card (Geek culture inspired) Kickstarter stretch goal expansion to Gameception.

Name: Zodiax
Description:
Zodiax is an abstract strategy game for 2 players(2-3 with expansion)in which each player controls 6 of the 12 signs of the Zodiac.
 Each sign has a unique force and ability that players can use to move one of their pieces into their opponent's gate and win. 
Zodiax is a simple and easy to learn game with deep strategy.
 Zodiax is a modular game, There are several different versions, each representing a different world Zodiac (Chinese Zodiac, Greek Zodiac, American Zodiac, Dinosaur Zodiac, etc.) Each version has the same rules but the pieces in the different sets have different powers. All sets are fully compatible so that players can use pieces from different sets to play against each other.

Name: Dirty Drawers
Description:
In Dirty Drawers, the judge for the round flips a card from the first three stacks of cards to form a randomized scenario for the rest of the players to draw. Next, they roll the dice for the drawing/judging criteria listed on the "Judge Card".

Drawers draw the random scenario keeping in mind the criteria from the "Judge Card". After drawing, each player reveals their drawing and competes for the Judge's vote.

The Judge selects a winning drawing based on the "Judge Card". The Drawer receives all cards used during the round. Each card is a point. After a set number of rounds, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Vikings Gone Wild: Magic's Corner Promo Card
Description:
A promo card from Bower's Game Corner Presents: Gen Con Video Bonanza 2017 Kickstarter Campaign.

This hero from Odin's Path costs 3 beer. When played, it allows the player to transform 1 element from one type to another.

Name: Cthulhu: Death May Die – Season 2 Expansion
Description:
The Season 2 expansion brings a lot of content to expand your experience with Death May Die. From a whole roster of unique Investigators, to 6 brand new Episodes, introducing all manner of new rules and elements to the game, utilizing a new set of game tiles, and pitting a host of terrifying new monsters in all shapes and sizes against the players!

The Season 2 Expansion comes with:

10 Investigator Figures
    17 Monster Figures
    10 Investigator Dashboards
    8 Game Tiles
    6 Episode Boxes (each of them containing 15 Discovery cards, 8 Mythos cards, 2 Episode cards, and tokens)

—description from the publisher

Name: Tour Operator: Cities
Description: Tour Operator: Cities is a mini-expansion that brings five new cities to the world of Tour Operator — and these aren't just average cities. Each of these cities has all five activities instead of just one or two!

Name: Brainbox: English
Description:
Grammar, punctuation and spelling: let's face it, important though they are, these have never been the easiest topics to make fun - until now! Let BrainBox English come to the rescue, helping you sort out pronouns from prepositions, adverbs from apostrophes and synonyms from syllables.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

Name: Super Godzilla Tempest
Description:
The fantastic adventure of Monster Island begins.

Super Godzilla is a dice racing game.
2 to 4 players can play.
The player who arrives first in the destination wins.
But a lot of obstacles await the player.
Especially the final jump will not be easy.

Who is Godzilla to be the monster king?

Name: Dogsbody: The Berwick Masterpiece Series
Description:
The match 'n' snatch card game that leads you a dog's life! Complete with cards, board and 5 animal dog figures plus bones.

The aim of the game is to be the first person to collect five bones. Bones may be collected by being the first person to collect all four pieces of one dog or by being the first person to recognise which dog another player has collected.

Name: Cthulhu: Death May Die – Yog–Sothoth
Description:
Yog–Sothoth Elder Box can be played with any episode of Cthulhu: Death May Die and contains:

     Yog-Sothoth and Wilbur Whateley figures
     4 Elder One cards
     Monsters card
     8 Mythos cards
     Tokens
     Box

Name: Cthulhu: Death May Die – Unspeakable Box
Description:
Unspeakable Box contains all Kickstarter exclusive stretch goals for Cthulhu: Death May Die unlocked during the campaign. It includes:

     5 plastic dashboard trays
     18 Investigators miniatures and boards
     DAGON elder one box (4 minis, 13 cards, 15 tokens)
     YOG-SOTHOTH elder one box
     LOST EPISODE 1 box (3 minis, 25 cards, 10 tokens)
     LOST EPISODE 2 box (4 minis, 25 cards, 10 tokens)
     LOST EPISODE 3 box (28 cards, 8 tokens)

Name: Cthulhu: Death May Die – Scarlett Hayes
Description: Kickstarter Exclusive Investigator Scarlett, including her Investigator figure and dashboard, available only for those who purchased Season 2 Expansion for Cthulhu: Death May Die during the Kickstarter Campaign

Name: Cthulhu: Death May Die – Black Goat of the Woods
Description:
The Black Goat of the Woods is an expansion for Cthulhu: Death May Die. This box brings an entire new Elder One for you to use in combination with any Episode, creating a whole new gaming experience as you try to fight through the swarm of Dark Young to eventually put an end to the Black Goat itself!

The Black Goat of the Woods box comes with:

     1 Black Goat of the Woods figure
     6 Dark Young figures
     8 Mythos cards
     4 Elder One cards
     1 Monsters card

Name: Temple of Knowledge
Description:
In Temple of Knowledge, players work together to explore a crumbling temple and find ancient books. Grab as many books as you can before the temple collapses! You and your teammates will work together to get the highest score you can.

Temple of Knowledge is an educational, cooperative game that is driven by flash cards. It can be played with any subject, and the more difficult the flash cards are, the more difficult the game will be!

On their turn, each player either discovers a new tile of the Temple or walks back over an old tile. As players get questions wrong and discover Crumble tiles, the Temple will begin to collapse. When it does, tiles flip over starting from the Crumble tiles and spreading from there. When each player has escaped from the Temple or been rescued, the game is over.

—description from the publisher

Name: Riga: Die Statue
Description: Riga: Die Statue is an expansion for Riga that includes one additional card for each player. You may now decide whether you want to use 2-4 of the "Riga" cards out of the five available (four from the base game, plus "Statue"). The Statue brings you 1 VP for every three coins you have left over at the end of the game.

Name: Aussie Outback Dice
Description:
This is a dice game for two or more players of any age.  Players try to score in one of fifteen categories on each turn.  The scoring categories are listed on a score sheet.  Examples include:  "3 Different Animals," "4 Koalas,"3 Emus," etc. At the end of the game each player adds the category scores together and subtracts any penalty points (from crocodile encounters!). The player with the highest total score wins the game.

There are five identical six-sided dice.  Each face has a picture of an animal on it (opposite face pairs on a die are lizard-koala, kangaroo-emu, and buffalo-crocodile).

Players roll all five dice, then may select dice for scoring.  The player can reroll twice and select dice each time, if desired. If a player cannot put a score down for any category after three rolls, the player must record a zero in one empty category.  Each and every appearance of a crocodile on every roll imposes an immediate 3-point penalty for that player.

The rules include an alternative game, optional penalties, and a listing of the odds for each type of dice roll.

The game consists of a card stock cover (with rules printed inside), five special dice, and a scorepad.  Everything is packaged in a clear plastic envelope.

—user summary

Name: Krosmaster: Brotherhood of the Forgotten
Description:
"Ignored by their parents who were too busy playing god, the members of the Brotherhood of the Forgotten are determined to let their anger show! Find Flopin, Elely, Toxine and the other members of the Brotherhood, including the mysterious Oropo, in this expansion and take advantage of their power."

This is a set of 16 new characters with cards for the Krosmaster family of games. Each Display case of 12 figurines comes with 4 random rares and one each of the 8 commons.

Name: NATO 1961: The Berlin Crisis
Description:
The Berlin Crisis was the culmination of a series of events that heated up the Cold War. Following the Bay of Pigs fiasco and the inconclusive Vienna Conference, Khrushchev saw Kennedy as a weak and inexperienced leader. He used this as an opportunity to solve the unresolved and aggravating problem: Berlin. East Germans were escaping to the West weekly by the thousands, creating economic chaos. A solution had to be reached. This led to Khrushchev's ultimatum demanding the withdrawal of Western armed forces from West Berlin and later, the construction of the Berlin Wall. Events continued to escalate to the point where opposing troops faced each other down gun barrels at Checkpoint Charlie.

NATO 1961 is a simulation of the potential for war in Germany, covering events that could have led to World War Three. Players assume the roles of President John F. Kennedy and the NATO powers or Soviet Premier Nikita Khrushchev and the Warsaw Pact general staffs. Confronted with the crisis, players can manage the conflict at a limited level or escalate it to full-out war between the Superpowers.

The 17"x22"map covers the Central Front including both East and West Germany as well as part of Czechoslovakia, France and the Low Lands. The 240 1/2" counters (die-cut and back-printed) show regimental, brigade and divisional level forces of the NATO and the Warsaw Pact.

Name: Junk'd
Description:
JUNK'D is a "fast, simple, destructive D6 dice pool play is easy teach, with loads of variation." A "PVP car combat game for up to 8 players." (Quotations are from the publisher description.) The ruleboook is available to purchase from DriveThruRPG, and it includes Print-and-Play materials as well as tips for those who wish to craft their own cars, obstacles, and tracks.

It is a player-elimination game where the last car on the road is the winner. However, eliminated players return to the game as "ghost riders"---kamikaze skeleton bikers who ride in the opposite direction as the other players. This twist keeps all the players active, even if they are eliminated early.

Name: Bowie
Description:
Bowie is a game best suited for 3 to 4 players. Each player will play David Bowie, or more accurately, a persona of David Bowie. The object of the game is to achieve the greatest legacy of any Bowie and survive the 1970’s. Legacy is judged by points earned from cutting records(flat, black, round- oh, nevermind). There is one slight problem. The Bowies are endangered by various threats, dark princes, and figures of the occult (which is in no way related to the copious amount of cocaine being inhaled by our hero). If any Bowie dies, all Bowies are dead and the game is lost.

—description from the designer

Name: Altiplano: The Traveler
Description:
A traveler wanders through the South American highlands and brings the inhabitants new ideas from his travels. Anyone who meets him can take advantage of these assets. A public trading point makes it possible to obtain rare goods in exchange for opals. And a variety of fortunes adds even more diversity to life among the mountain ranges in Bolivia and Peru.

With Altiplano: The Traveler, the planning of moves in Altiplano becomes more important and accessibility to resources becomes more interactive. Above all, the assets that may be purchased from the traveller open up completely new ways to increase one's own wealth. But unforeseen fortunes sometimes demand spontaneous decisions which influence planning.

Thus, the drive for success in this inhospitable region turns into a completely new challenge! Who's prepared for this?

—description from the publisher

Name: Talomir Tales Distant Shores
Description:
Talomir Tales Distant Shores is an easy to get into adventure game that will generate unique stories for your characters. You can play one scenario or many scenarios stringed together for a campaign. It can be played with card stock counters (included), miniatures and even pen and paper.

Talomir Tales Distant Shores includes:

Character creation is quick with 30 unique attributes.
15 unique creatures lists, Demons, Dwarves, Ghouls, Wererats, Elves, Hill Giants & others. 
Humans from 9 regions.
10 classes to define your characters.
Interact with characters and Intimidate creatures 
Streamlined combat system that includes magic.
A system to reward success and failure.
16 Scenarios
Easy Dungeon generator with a Big Bad
Pre-generated 16 scenario adventure.

Designed for solo and cooperative play against the game where no two games will ever play out the same!

The Talomir Tales Distant Shores 60 page rule book includes color card stock counters and a color Battle Board to play on.

Name: The Worst Game Ever: Secret Agendas Promo
Description:
Point this card at another seat as your secret hate. If the player in that seat is eliminated, you get 10 tokens from the kitty at the end of the game.

This card was included in the game "Desert Island."

Name: Trillionaire: The Card Game
Description:
Billionaires from all sorts of dimensions have traveled through wormholes in space and time and have arrived in the same place. They all have one goal in mind... to become the first trillionaire in the universe (or universes)!

Trillionaire is a card game that comes with pre-built, balanced decks so it can be played right out of the box. Players continue battling until one obtains 10 Cash Cards ($1 Trillion worth) and successfully deposits their full Trillion into the bank. You can only obtain sufficient Cash Cards for victory by Bankrupting opponents' Billionaire Cards.

Billionaires range from a sentient computer from Neato Prime, who philanthropically solves global problems, to a space traveling asteroid miner from the Bermuda Wormhole dimension. Each player must ‘Lawyer up’ their Billionaires to make them ready for battle with opposing Billionaires, while also playing Control Cards to influence their own and other players’ actions.

Every player starts with a deck of 60 cards. Players may use one of the pre-built decks, or each player's deck may be customized before play begins. Trillionaire was designed from the start to be both highly customizable and strategic.

There are four categories of cards which make up each deck:


     Cash Cards - Worth $100 Billion each, these cards are the heart of the game. If you successfully put 10 Cash Cards on the table, you may attempt to deposit them to win the game!
     Billionaire Cards - These character cards serve as your front line to Sue and Bankrupt your opponents' Billionaires. Comes in "Standard" and "Super" varieties.
     Lawyer Cards - These cards are attached to your Billionaire Cards, enabling them to Sue your opponents. Without them, your Billionaires wouldn't be able to do anything. Comes in "Standard" and "Power" varieties.
     Control Cards - These cards help you control the game in your favor. Some involve greater risk, but have a greater reward.


If players choose to customize their decks, they must follow certain rules:


     There are no more than 10 Star Cards allowed per deck. (Every card is either a Star Card or a Non-Star Card.)
     Your deck must contain exactly 15 Cash Cards. 
     All players must have exactly 1 Veto Card in their deck.
     Players may only have up to 3 of any card that is not a Cash Card, Standard Lawyer, or Veto card.


Trillionaire can be played with a teammate (2 v 2) or as a free-for-all (up to 4 players).

—description from the publisher

Name: EverWyrd Fantasy Gaming
Description:
EverWyrd is a Dungeon crawling adventure roleplaying game where you become the hero(es) in a constantly changing world. Using map cards randomly drawn from the deck, you and your friends will create worlds of adventure, peril, and battle; more importantly, you will collect and horde wonderous treasures while questing your way across the land and towards legendary status.

The 2020 update will include all-new, original artwork, different playable races, new cards, and an entirely new format. We will also have all creatures and example heroes as 2D print & play miniatures.

The world of EverWyrd had its origins with the Elves and Dwarves who forged a balance of work and life that allowed them to live in peace and harmony. The elves took the surface domains of Ral and Friijlant, while the dwarves toiled in the caverns and tunnels beneath Ashland Heights and Eryn. In order to survive, both learned the ways of the other, but only as a means to provide for each other. Thus, for thousands of years did they live in peace together; dwarves forging weapons and minting precious metals, the elves hunting, farming, and encouraging life to sustain and prosper above. 
All this would change with men. Seeking a better life - an easier life perhaps - man moved north, across the marshes from the land of Ibros, to live amongst the elves and dwarves. Both peoples were curious about men. Those creatures were notoriously greedy and often cruel to one another. Could they learn to live in peace as the elves and dwarves had done?
Û   Û   Û
Each side believing in their cause, each side using powerful magic that would corrupt the lands in which they fought. Their wars would drive the elves from the land of EverWyrd, with the exception of a small band who would become the Sidhe, the last of the elves born with magical abilities and skill to them. The Sidhe built a stronghold in Calus, deep in the forest at the base of great mountains and shunned the human race.
The dwarves, who had made their home in the tunnels and caves underground found their homes collapsing from the heaving of the corruptions of magic. They tried in vain to fight against the power of the Warlocks, but they could not resist them. In the end, the dwarves died out or found safety in the more remote lands of EverWyrd, fearing their numbers would never recoup their loss. The dwarves, like the elves, would never be inclined to share with the human race again. From their icy tunnels in the Frigid Peaks, the dwarves watched man destroy itself.
As the armies of men clashed, great warriors, powerful magic-users, and assassins from the shadow rose and fell in great numbers. Such it was that the humans destroyed themselves. Those who fought were killed however possible, and those who did not die ceased to fight. After years of carnage, so few were left that they finally agreed to end their battles. Practicing the dark power of NecoMagia was outlawed, save for a select few who studied relentlessly and proved their value to the councils. Wyrd, being the purest form of magic became revered and the power behind the thrones of EverWyrd would forevermore be that of the powerful witches and wizards that thrived. 
None recognized the damage they had done to the world itself. The tunnels and underground caves, the murky underworld of EverWyrd, had been forever transformed. Creatures that had never before existed now thrived in the corrupted magic left behind by the great war, and they became a threat to the people and other races that now sought to live their life on the surface of EverWyrd.
Û   Û   Û
Thus, does your story take place, a thousand years after that first group of men reached for a better life, only to find their future generations destroying everything they believed in. As man stretched its wings to discover the art of magic and use magic, so too did they actively destroy their own world. What lies beneath the ground for which thousands walk? Are you brave enough to find out? What other things might you learn if you delve into the reasons behind the thrones of EverWyrd? What magic, power, and riches might you discover if you’re brave enough to dare?

Name: ZAM
Description:
ZAM is a game between two players.  The object of the the game is to "exterminate all the Zammen of the adverse side or leave some immovable."  The game is played on an 8x8 checkered board.

The pieces are made of colored wood, one side red, the other yellow.  Each color has two shapes:  either a short cylinder with a hole through the axis, or a short cylinder with a post protruding from the center.

A short cylinder with the central hole is called a "SOL."  It moves diagonally one square at a time, forward or rearward.  It captures forward only.  When it reaches the extreme end of the board it is promoted to a "ZAM" by placing it upon one PARPY of the opponent.

The PARPY has a post protruding upwards from its base.  It moves one or two squares diagonally in any direction and can jump over a friendly SOL to an unoccupied space.  It captures forward only.  It can be promoted to KING upon reaching the far rank by turning it over and inserting it into an opposing SOL.

The ZAM has complicated movement and capturing abilities and restrictions.  It can move one space diagonally, or two diagonal spaces not in the same line.  It captures by leaping (with certain restrictions).

The KING can move in any direction.  It can move one or two squares diagonally or two squares vertically or horizontally.

The rules are presented in the form of fourteen laws.

The game comes in a small box.  There are six SOLs and six PARPYs included, along with a paper board and an instruction pamphlet.

—user summary

Name: Wow! Werewolf
Description:
A Japanese produced werewolf game that uses panels such as houses and roads to play!

Combining the panels of houses and roads will make the village board. Villagers will sleep in seperate houses every evening. Wolves can only raid along the road! Furthermore, there are special houses such as church where werewolves cannot attack and a log cabin that can block the road with logs to interfere with the attacks of werewolves.

Depending on different elements of movement, building and player powers, new developments and strategies that have never existed will be born!

Name: Jibe Card Game
Description:
Jibe is a strategic matching card game.

The Cards

There are twelve icons, each with a different point value. Each six-sided card has either two sets of three identical icons or one set of six identical icons. The cards with six identical icons are known as a “core” cards. There are 80 unique cards. There are four colors associated with the icons. Each color is shared by three icons.

The value of each card is the sum of the values of each icon set on the card and is displayed in the center of the card.

The icon set values are as follows: Can=0; Joker=0; Beakers=5; Pencil=10; Bulb=15; Note=20; Star=25; Heart=30; Plane=35; Gear=40; Key=45; Fire=50.
Play

There is a core card for every icon. Every round of the game is started by placing a core card in the center of the playing surface. You can play just one round, or you can play multiple rounds, starting with a different core card each time. Choose it before distributing cards to the players.

Deal five cards to each player. During your turn, play one card from your hand by matching the colors or icons with cards already played. If you just match the color(s), you can only count the value of the card you laid down. If you match the icon(s), you can count the value of your card plus the value of each card(s) where the icon(s) matched. All colors must match, except when a joker is played.

If you play a core card during your turn, you can play another card during your turn to match it.

After your play, you replenish your hand by drawing one card from the pile. If you play a core card and are able to match it with another card from your hand, you draw two cards.

If you can’t play or choose not to play during your turn, pick up one card from the pile.

Jokers are wild. They can match any icon and each of the three Joker core cards can be used to match six cards at once. They have no point value when played, but make sure you play them, because their value switches to 100 points and count against your score if left in your hand.

Record your score after each play. Keep playing until all the cards in the pile are drawn. Then play until someone has played all their cards or until no other play can be made. Each player then adds up the card values left in their hand and subtracts the sum from their score.

If you play multiple rounds, you can add the scores from each round to determine the winner. Or, you can treat each round separately, award a point to the player with the highest score for each round, and the winner is the player who won the most rounds.

Name: Horse & Musket: Annual #1
Description:
Horse and Musket Annual Number 1 is the first fan expansion to Horse & Musket. It will add new scenarios for owners of Volumes I-III and some optional rules for greater realism.

The scenarios include...

The Boyne - July 11, 1690 – Lillibullero

Steenkerque - August 3, 1692 – The End of the Pike

Torroella - May 27, 1694 – The Flight of the Spaniards

Zenta - September 11, 1697 – Hapsburg Zenith

Ramillies - May 23, 1706 – Marlborough’s Greatest Victory

Oudenaarde - July 11, 1708 – “Another hour of daylight…”

Lesnaya - September 28, 1708 – “Glorious Victory at Lesnaya”

Gadebusch - December 9, 1712 – A Battle Won and a War Lost

Stresow - November 15, 1715 – “Is There No God Beside Me?”

Fort Rosalie - November 29, 1729 – “Everything was on fire and covered in blood…”

Villmanstrand - August 23, 1741 – Lacy Smashes Sweden

Campo Santo - February 8, 1743 – The First Victory of Maria Theresa’s Reign

Kars - August 9, 1745 – Nader’s Last Battle

Falkirk - January 17, 1746 – Last Chance for the Jacobites

Bergen op Zoom - September 13, 1747 – “…either hang him or make him Marshal of France.”

Gross-Jägersdorf - August 30, 1757 – Lehwaldt’s Gamble

Breslau    - November 22, 1757 – Bevern’s Stand

Wandiwash - January 22, 1760 – “Then followed the battle that gave us India.”

Sainte-Foy - April 28, 1760 – French Canada’s Denouement

Liegnitz - August 15, 1760 - Frederick Escapes Daun’s Trap

—description from the publisher
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession
History: War of the Spanish Succession

Name: Horse & Matchlock: Prelude to an Era
Description:
Horse & Matchlock is the prologue to Horse & Musket: Dawn of an Era. This volume will cover warfare from 1618-1682, when the armies of Europe shifted from heavy pike formations to linear lines of musketeers. Warfare moved towards firepower, although firepower was curbed by the limitations of the matchlock musket. In addition, bayonets were rare and the pike was the infantry's best defense against cavalry. It was also the last time in this era that religion was a major factor in the causes and ferocity of European warfare. The volume includes battles from the Thirty Years War, Franco-Spanish War, English Civil Wars, The Fronde, Franco-Dutch War, and Scanian War.

The scenarios include...

White Mountain - November 8, 1620 – Last Stand of the Bohemian Revolt

Wimpfen - May 6, 1622 – Slow Grind to Victory

Fleurus    - August 29, 1622 – "Altera Restat"

Lutter am Barenberge - August 17, 1626 – Tilly’s Greatest Victory

Breitenfeld - September 17, 1631 – Gustav II Adolf’s Masterpiece

Lützen - November 17, 1632 – “I was the King of Sweden.”

Edgehill - October 23, 1642 – “For God and King Charles!”

Rocroi - May 19, 1643 – El Ultimo Tercio

First Newbury - September 20, 1643 – Essex’s Finest Hour

Cheriton - March 29, 1644 – “The best shifter and chooser of ground.”

Marston Moor - July 2, 1644 – “…he will fight, whatever comes of ‘t!”

Aberdeen - September 13, 1644 – The Craibstane Rout

Auldearn - May 9, 1645 – Slaughter on Garlic Hill

Naseby - June 14, 1645 – “Will you go upon your Death?”

Kilsyth - August 15, 1645 – Slaughter Howe

Lens - August 20, 1648 – The Peace of Westphalia

Worcester - September 3, 1651 – The Royal Oak

The Dunes - June 11, 1658 – The Tides of Battle

Sinsheim - June 16, 1674 – Turenne Invades the Palatinate

Seneffe    - August 11, 1674 – Condé’s Last Bloody Hurrah

Lund - December 4, 1676 – Return of the King

Landskrona - July 14, 1677 – The Småländska Peasantry Wins the Day

—description from the publisher

NOTE: This game’s title is actually Horse & Matchlock. Please use this title for any discussion or writing about the game.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Power Zone
Description:
Power Zone is specially designed for maximum play - 5 games in 1! The dual position pockets can be closed or opened to create a variety of challenges. In some games, players take turns aiming and shooting; in others, you battle simultaneously. Every game, no matter which you choose, is an action-packed experience.
—description from the manual

Power Zone resembles a circular version of Crossfire, with 2 disc launchers and 6 goals.
—user summary

Name: Big Trouble in Little China: The Game – Deluxe Edition
Description:
There is a secret world where ancient evil weaves a modern mystery… they call it Little China. It’s where Big Trouble was waiting for Jack Burton and his friends as they uncover an ancient diabolical plot. The evil minions of the immortal ghost-sorcerer Lo Pan are waiting to chop down the players with axes and guns in dark alleys and all throughout the battle-torn streets of Chinatown. Now, Jack, Wang, Gracie, and the rest of the gang must muster up all of their courage, survive against hordes of baddies, and then face off in a showdown with the darkest demon of them all Lo Pan!

Big Trouble in Little China the Game sends you and up to three other players on a wild adventure to experience the unknown and mystical underworld of Chinatown. Each brave character uses their own unique talents and abilities to take on various missions throughout Little China; working together to gain enough Audacity to take down Lo Pan, the Three Storms, and a slew of other powerful henchmen, in this cooperative, replayable, cinematic experience.

You will venture through the iconic locations in Chinatown saving the helpless and thwarting evil plans, all the while discovering weapons and rare magics to use to your benefit. Player actions are powered by thematic dice that are rolled each round. These dice will be used to take part in combat, testing your luck taking audacious actions, and get players in and out of “Big Trouble." But beware: roll bad luck and suffer the consequences!

The clock’s ticking as Lo Pan inches closer to breaking the curse and regaining his mortal form. The heroes are thrown into a final showdown with Lo Pan and his most elite bodyguards to finally put an end to his reign of terror. You’ll need all of your guts and glory to rescue the green eyed beauty, defeat ancient magic, and save Chinatown... in Big Trouble in Little China: the Game!

—description from the publisher

The Deluxe Edition comes in a gold foil box and includes the Big Trouble in Little China: The Game â€“ Legacy of Lo Pan Expansion and the Big Trouble in Little China: The Game â€“ Six Demons Promo.
Families: Movies: Big Trouble in Little China

Name: Egghead
Description: A tense and exciting general knowledge game for two or more players, aged 7 and above.

Name: Sue Sue Sue: Arnold Brothers Lawsuit Game
Description:
The object of Sue Sue Sue is to sue your fellow players with a lawsuit, pay the smallest amount of lawyer fees, and pay out the least amount of money when another player sues you.
     You must make the best of a difficult situation in terms of money.  The player with the largest net worth in terms of cash and cash value of assets at the end of the game is the winner.
     The end of the game is determined by a time limit agreed upon by all players such as one, two, or three hours,  The game's end may also occur when only one player is not bankrupt.  Bankruptcy terminates a player's participation in the game.
The equipment consists of the game board, 2 dice, 6 token players, 6 stock certificates, 6 houses, 6 cars, 8 "Expert Witness" cards, 8 "Lawsuit" Cards, "Small Claim's Court" cards, and "Good News" cards.

—user summary

Name: Clash of Fate
Description:
Clash of Fate is combat-based strategy card game where each player selects a team of 3 characters to battle against the opposing characters.

Clash of Fate characters are mostly traditional fantasy including a druid who shapeshifts into a werewolf, a lich, and a priestess. While the characters have their own backstory, they have been summoned to fight for a contest between two wizards.

The goal of the game is to defeat all of your opponent's characters. The game comes with pre-constructed decks for each character, but there are bonus cards that can be used to try new strategies.

—description from the publisher

Name: Metka Avaruusmatka
Description: Bingo with a twist. Throw two special dice and each player checks the color and number for what space they can cover on their astroboard. Player who first covers the whole route of one spaceship and yells "Ignition" wins the game.

Name: Noggin Workshop Picture Problems
Description:
Noggin Workshop Picture Problems card game makes brain training fun!  Train your brain with this visually intriguing assortment of pattern recognition, geometrical, and mathematical riddles.  It's not what you know, it's how you think!

Noggin Workshop is Outset Media’s brand of card games dedicated to making your brain broil and bubble!  These mind teaser card brain games challenge you with logic puzzles, word puzzles, geometry riddles to sequence puzzles!  The card brain games promote logic, lateral thinking, visualization and other mental exercises that your brain may not use on a regular basis. Limber up, it’s thinking time!

What you see may not be what you get!

—description from the publisher

Name: As Long as the Grass Grows: The Conquest of the American West 1845-1881
Description:
Beyond the great river Mississippi, where a part of your nation has gone, your father has provided a country large enough for all of you, and he advises you to remove to it. There your white brothers will not trouble you; they will have no claim to the land, and you can live upon it, you and all your children, as long as the grass grows or the water runs, in peace and plenty. It will be yours for ever.

President Andrew Jackson

As Long as the Grass Grows is a card driven board game depicting the Conquest of the American West from the Texas Annexation of 1845 to the surrender of Sitting Bull in 1881. At the start of each turn a President card is drawn and resolved, to determine the policies of the new administration, foreign affairs, and gold rushes. The players draw Action cards, make agreements, and play their cards as Events or for Action Points so they can move, raid, and fight with troops of cavalry and infantry, or tribal warbands. The United States Player wins by protecting pioneer trails, upgrading them to railroads, civilising tribes, and seizing control of territories, particularly those with pioneers and gold. The Great Plains, Northwestern, and Southwestern Tribal Players win by resisting the westward advance of the United States, maintaining control their homelands, and avoiding the Reservation for as long as possible.

Includes


     Scenarios for 1845-57, 1857-69 and 1869-81, which can be combined into campaign scenarios.
     Two player alternate history game with no US player.
     108 Event cards including Generals, Chiefs, Pioneers, Gold Rushes, and Epidemics.
     10 President Cards representing every president from 1845 to 1881, reflecting the policy of their administration.
     Buffalo, Gold, Massacre, Trail, Peace Chief, and War Chief markers.
     California, Oregon, Mormon, Bozeman, Smoky Hill, Santa Fe, Old Spanish, and Goodnight-Loving Trails allow rapid movement across the continent, may be raided by local tribes, and upgraded to railroads.
     Control of territories by the British, Mexicans, Mormons, Texans, CSA, USA, and Tribes.
     Variable victory conditions, increasing for the US and decreasing for Tribal Factions as the game proceeds.


—description from the designer

Name: Fame The Board Game
Description:
It all begins with a dream. In an incredibly competitive atmosphere, plagues with self-doubt, each player's passion will be put to the test. As each player strives for his or her moment in the spotlight, they'll discover who among them has the innate talent and necessary discipline ti succeed and achieve Fame....Have you got what it takes? i.e 'Blow and imaginary, huge bubble gum bubble until it pops all over your head'.  'Pretend you are a dog trying to scratch a flea that you can't quite reach for 1 minute' plus much more.

A fantastic gift for fans of the brilliant TV show Fame.

—description from the publisher

Name: Time Vault Soccer: Football card game
Description:
Defy the tyranny of modern football #DTTOMF

Time Vault Soccer is the definitive celebration of the great, good and interesting from soccer through the decades. It’s football with time machines… cards, shouting, knee slides and sulking.

It’s got magic but absolutely no unicorns… because it’s a football game.

ENDLESS POSSIBILITIES

Time Vault Soccer is a football card game in which two Bosses (You’re one) each assemble a squad of 16 players with special skills and abilities. You combine your players in unique ways to perform bespoke moves and strategically outwit your opponents in a game of football. As a living card game you choose your squads from an ever growing pool of real players from the 1950’s to the 1990’s.

Whether you’re having fun at the kitchen table, playing a high-stakes league and cup format in the pub, or upstairs on your bed sulking because your master plan turned to custard… which it will, because it’s football… there’s a place for you here.

Family friendly (8+), suits any gaming occasion for 2 players or multiple players in a cup, league or tournament format, fast paced, plays in 20-30 minutes and is super easy to learn… but a devil to master.

A little more on the gameplay…

Bosses take alternate turns to build and then trigger attacking and defending moves whilst special skills enable you to break the rules, enhance your moves and disrupt your opponent.

There are no restrictions placed on formations or style of play. You decide who is in your team and how your team will play. You can build your team around Bobby Moore (Inspirational Skill), Jimmy Greaves (On Fire Skill), Pele (Thunderbolt Shot Skill) or go all disruptor and throw in Tony Adams (Offside Specialist Skill) to frustrate your opponent… or blend them all together.

The first release of 64 cards, “Debut” pits ready to play squads from the 1960’s vs the 1970’s and is supported by expansion squads for the 1950’s and 1980’s. Full list of sets:

•    Debut starter set - 1970’s vs 1980’s
•    Debut expansion squad - 1950’s
•    Debut expansion squad - 1980’s
•    Rivals Starter Set - England 1966 vs West Germany 1990
•    Nucleus 1 expansion squad - Italy 1981/82
•    Nucleus 2 expansion squad - Tottenham Hotspur 1960/61
•    Nucleus 3 expansion squad - Nottingham Forest 1977/78
•    Nucleus 4 expansion squad - Real Madrid 1957/58
•    Nucleus 5 expansion squad - Arsenal 1970/71

Although ready to play straight out of the box Time Vault Soccer is designed to be a tournament game where you customise your own squad to take on your opponents.

Individual "Special" cards are also available

•    Zinedine Zidane 1997/98
•    Roberto Carlos 2001/02
•    Dennis Bergkamp 1997/98
•    Matthiaus Sammer 1995/96
•    George Weah 1993/94

—description from the publisher

Name: Tattigol
Description:
Tattigol is a board game that simulates the game of football, enhancing its tactical aspects; it does not use dice or cards as it usually happens for "football setting" boardgames.

The exciting newness of Tattigol compared to the classic "chess matrix" games, is that the player who attacks, realizes his game tactics not only with the movement of man but also with the ball movement, with which he tries to realize the goal.

Men's movements and ball's movement depend on the role of the pawns and the 2 players have 15 pieces available with 8 different roles to select to form their team: this situation creates dynamism and tactics really exciting both in attack and in defense and contrast .

—description from the designer

Name: Spin Mania
Description: Spin Mania - Players must pick up and carry spinning plates from the spin-base to stands placed in awkward places by their opponents. This exciting, action packed game is a race to find the fastest plate placer.

Name: Universal Fighting System: Mortal Kombat X CCG
Description:
The Mortal Kombat X CCG allows players to take control of their favorite Earthrealm, Netherrealm, and Outworld fighters in an action-packed, strategic, two player card game, replicating the excitement and intensity of the classic fighting game series. Mortal Kombat X CCG players are not limited to fighting for dominance of the realms, as the Mortal Kombat X CCG is part of the Universal Fighting System CCG (UFS) and compatible with all UFS sets and licenses.

—description from the publisher

Name: Carol Vorderman's Tribond Game
Description:
Addictive, challenging and competitive, Carol Vorderman’s Tribond will test your knowledge to the extreme. Three clues, one answer!

Simple yet challenging game play. Engaging and addictive. All about the “THREEZER” puzzles, move around the board answering set number of THREEZERS, winning points as you go along. What links 3 things together e.g. Florida, piano, locksmiths? Answer is they all have keys!

—description from the publisher

Name: Wendake: New Allies
Description:
Year 1756: French and English armies are arriving in the Great Lakes area. Forming commercial and military alliances with them could be very useful to help your nation prosper!

Thanks to the new turn cards and the new alliance action in Wendake: New Allies, you can:


    Take advantage of the French and English patrols to consolidate your influence in the territories.
    Use your canoes to trade pelts and obtain precious rifles.
    Use rifles to gain victory points — or to activate special effects!


Can you take advantage of the European presence in your territories better than your rivals?

Wendake: New Allies introduces new mechanisms in the base game. Now, you will use your fourth tribe marker to select a turn card in addition to the choice of turn order for next round. Turn cards allow you to perform powerful effect and also to take the new alliance action, which allows you to choose whether to ally with the French or English army, and to call for their help to control the territories in game, or to trade your pelts to obtain their rifles.

You can use rifles to claim new turtle tiles or to activate the most powerful turn cards.

In addition to this, Event cards are added to the Solitare play to make it more challenging!

Name: Dark Legacy: The Rising – Levels 5-7
Description:
Fight for control of Titan using exotic creatures, weapons, armor and relics in Dark Legacy: The Rising – Levels 5-7. With skill and planning, your army will become stronger, more dominant! When you level up, stronger, more powerful weapons, armor and magical spells become available for you to use to annihilate your enemies. What are you waiting for?

This expansion includes skill cards for every faction from level 5 to 7.

Name: Time of Legends: Joan of Arc – Reliquary Box
Description: The reliquary box includes all the Stretch Goals from the Kickstarter campaign (but the Super Exclusive Stretch Goals).
Families: Game: Time of Legends – Joan of Arc

Name: MICROStars SuperClub Football
Description:
An Action Challenge soccer game using standard rules of soccer and dexterity for ball movement.

MICROStars SuperClub Football uses real soccer hero figures in their real kits to compete against each other in full-match soccer.  You help your footballers to dribble, pass, shoot, and save in this action packed, miniatures soccer game.

Additionally you can collect MicroStars from your favorite teams with fillers to world class players like Messi, Henry, Rooney, Cannavaro, Nemyer, Ozel, Ronaldo, Beckham and more.

Play occurs on a tabletop felt pitch and movement is controlled by holding your player figure by the head and using one of four techniques to hit and move the ball.  Additional player movment of teammates is controlled by measuring sticks to move your players on the pitch.  The standard game is played over two 10-minute timed periods with a 3-minute half-time break.  Tied games at the end of the match can be decided by a Golden Goal or additional play time as agreed on by the players.

There are rules for fouls, free kicks, penalties, goalkeeper play, offsides, corners, throw-in's, kick-offs, and more.

Contents:
- 2 SuperClub Pitch (felt 35x56")
- 2 Goals
- 3 Balls
- 1 Rulebook
- 2 Goalkeeper rods
- 2 Measuring Sticks (long and small)
- 22 assorted MicroStars from top clubs in the world including 2 goalkeepers

Name: MicroStars Microdome Soccer
Description:
MICRODOME Soccer puts your squads to the test to prove who's best.

The game uses MicroStars miniatures, each having five statistics on their base for Passing, Tackling, Crossing, Shooting, and Dribbling.  Different base colors denote better player skills in specific areas.  You'll need to build a balanced team including defenders, midfielders, and strikers and of coarse a top-notch goalie.  Winning is about knowing your player's powers and when to best use them.

The objective of the game is to complete 32 moves in each match (16 in each half) and score more goals than your opponent.  The game is played on a pitch marked with a grid, where each grid point defines what may be accomplished from that position.

Moves are made by calling and winning Skill Challenges allowing you to progress the ball to better positions down the pitch.  There are 5,6,7,8, or 9 Skill Challenges in each Move and you can only score from one of the 32 shooting positions.  Of course the goalie will have a chance to block your shot.

Contents:
- MicroDome play pitch and stadium that doubles as a carry-case
- 16 exclusive MicroStars miniatures including 2 black-base "rares"
- 2 goals
- Stadium backdrop and benches for your teams
- Rules of Play

Name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Protectors Starter – G.U.A.R.D.
Description:
In Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game, two or more giant kaiju monsters brawl, blast, and body-slam each other in a dense destructible urban environment. Alongside these towering monsters, lesser minions such as powerful tanks, fighter jets, flying saucers, fearsome dinosaurs, and demonic fiends fight to capture important locations and help power their monster to victory.

Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Protectors Starter – G.U.A.R.D. includes the giant Defender X and five G.U.A.R.D. units. This is a single-player "Protectors" starter box and must be combined with a red "Destroyers" box in order to play the game.

Name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Destroyers Starter – Planet Eaters
Description:
In Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game, two or more giant kaiju monsters brawl, blast, and body-slam each other in a dense destructible urban environment. Alongside these towering monsters, lesser minions such as powerful tanks, fighter jets, flying saucers, fearsome dinosaurs, and demonic fiends fight to capture important locations and help power their monster to victory.

Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Destroyers Starter – Planet Eaters includes the giant Gorghadra and five Planet Eater units. This is a single-player "Destroyers" starter box and must be combined with a blue "Protectors" box in order to play the game.

Name: Time of Legends: Joan of Arc – Ottoman Army
Description: The Ottoman Army expansion includes 49 miniatures and unit cards.
Families: Game: Time of Legends – Joan of Arc

Name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Brotherhood of Steel: Core Box
Description:
This Fallout: Wasteland Warfare set contains 32mm scale resin miniatures with scenic bases. Each set provides an expansion to the game with new cards for player vs player and AI game modes.

Contents:
2 Lancers
2 Field Scribes
2 Knight Patrol
1 T60 Paladin with Gatling Laser
7 Scenic Bases
9 Large Cards (Unit, AI, Reference)
30+ Small Cards (Items, Boost, Heroic, Quest, Perk, Leader, Explore, Event, Wasteland)

Name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Brotherhood of Steel: Frontline Knights
Description:
This Fallout: Wasteland Warfare set contains 32mm scale resin miniatures with scenic bases. Each set provides an expansion to your game with new cards for player vs player and AI game modes.

Contents:
1 Knight in T60 Armour
3 Knight Patrol in Combat Armour with Laser Rifles
4 Scenic Bases
4 Large Cards (Unit, AI)
14+ Small Cards (Items, Boost, Explore, Events, Wasteland)

Name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Brotherhood of Steel: Knight-Captain Cade and Paladin Danse
Description:
This Fallout: Wasteland Warfare set contains 32mm scale resin miniatures with scenic bases. Each set provides an expansion to your game with new cards for player vs player and AI game modes.

Contents:
1 Knight-Captain Cade
1 Paladin Danse
1 Eyebot
3 Scenic Bases
6 Large Cards (Unit, AI)
10+ Small Cards (Items, Boosts, Quests, Perks, Leaders)

Name: Kingdom Builder: Family Box
Description:
In Kingdom Builder, the players create their own kingdoms by skillfully building their settlements, aiming to earn the most gold at the end of the game.

Nine different kinds of terrain are on the variable game board, including locations and castles. During his turn, a player plays his terrain card and builds three settlements on three hexes of this kind. If possible, a new settlement must be built next to one of that player’s existing settlements. When building next to a location, the player may seize an extra action tile that he may use from his next turn on. These extra actions allow extraordinary actions such as moving your settlements.

By building next to a castle, the player will earn gold at the end of the game, but the most gold will be earned by meeting the conditions of the three Kingdom Builder cards; these three cards (from a total of ten in the game) specify the conditions that must be met in order to earn the much-desired gold, such as earning gold for your settlements built next to water hexes or having the majority of settlements in a sector of the board.

Each game, players will use a random set of Kingdom Builder cards, special actions, and terrain sectors to build the map! Kingdom Builder: Big Box ramps up this variability by including all expansions to date, ensuring you'll never play the same game twice!

All in one box, the Family Box includes the base game, the Nomads expansion, materials for a 5th player and 2 Queenies (The Caves & The Capitol).
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Elon Musk's iPod Submarine
Description:
A game of terrible solutions to terrifying problems

Each player is given a piece of paper with either a six word problem statement (eg kids stuck in flooded cave, foreign interference with election, cat vomit on carpet, etc) OR the words Elon Musk.

Then each player pitches their solution to the problem. Of course, being no-nonsense billionaire tech-bro geniuses, they can only say two words to sum up their solution. One player doesn't know the problem. They are Elon Musk, and can only babble random words (eg if problem is kids stuck in flooded cave - players say things like "robot divers", "cave drill", "waterproof bats". The player who is Elon says "ipod submarine" or "space roadster".

Once everyone has had a pitch the players try to figure out who - if anyone - is Elon Musk. If they are right - they win... unless Elon Musk has successfully guessed what the problem is. If he has, Elon wins and everyone else loses.

Name: Last Full Measure: The Battle of Hanover
Description:
June 30th, 1863: During Lee's invasion of Pennsylvania, Stuart and the cavalry were trying to link up with Ewell's corp believed to be near York PA.  On the way there, they ran into Kilpatrick's division of Union cavalry.

Last Full Measure is a free print-and-play game of the Battle of Hanover, the forth game in the LFM series.

A brigade scale game that uses regiment counters, as opposed to generic line markers, to spread the brigade over multiple hexes according to it's size. Ranged artillery fire, cavalry charges, command and control, all in only eight pages of rules. Play aids include Player-aid card with CRT and other charts and table; Eliminated Units card, Order of Arrival card, and 240 2-sided counters.

The map measures 23" x 27" at a scale of 250 yard per 3/4" hex.

Name: Dark Legacy: The Rising – Levels 8-12
Description: Dark Legacy: The Rising – Levels 8-12 has more goodies for existing Dark Legacy: The Rising decks.

Name: Dark Legacy: The Rising – Levels 13-20
Description: Dark Legacy: The Rising – Levels 13-20 has more goodies for existing Dark Legacy: The Rising decks.

Name: Luxor: Exclusive Queenie
Description:
Kickstarter exclusive content that is mixed with the corresponding components in their respective Queenies.

This was packaged by itself, outside of the Luxor box.

Includes:
3 scarabs for Luxor: Queenie 1
2 agility tiles for Luxor: Queenie 2
2 mission tiles for Luxor: Queenie 3
2 small sarcophagi for Luxor: Queenie 4
1 chamber tile for Luxor: Queenie 4
1 rules booklet

Name: Ship It!
Description:
The game of project management.

It’s a simple card game for three to five players, designed to help people talk through the various things that happen when you’re making software. You shuffle the deck and draw cards. Cards can be drivers, blockers, or actions. Your goal is to ship three phases of your project. You do this by getting rid of your blockers, collecting enough drivers, and yelling “SHIP IT!”

Drivers move a phase forward… blockers keep you from shipping… and Actions change the state of play.

Name: Sons of Mars
Description:
Sons of Mars is a rule set that gives players the ability to recreate the gladiatorial games of ancient Rome on the table top. Build your ludus from the ground up and take to the sands of the arena with a deep campaign system that has gladiator progression, ludus expansion, special events and much more.

The combat system in Sons of Mars aims to take the fighting beyond simple dice rolling and leans toward a more tactical approach. With a combination of 13 different actions and 30+ abilities the players, not the dice gods, will have the most control over how the battles on the sands of the arena unfold.

Inside this book you will also find rules for 17 classes of gladiators, 10 beasts, over 20 different match types, 4 Roman festivals with themed matches, 40+ NPCs (Non Player Characters), plus rules for campaign and solo play.

The arenas crowd is chanting your name, will you answer their call?

—description from the publisher

Name: Dawn of the Zeds (Third Edition): Expansion Pack #1 –  Stepping Forward
Description:
The first Dawn of the Zeds: Third Edition Expansion Pack features â€‹4 new characters (3 heroes and 1 heroic civilians), who â€‹are stepping forward, ready to â€‹confront the Zeds.

"Big Wheels" Carter brings truckloads of supplies and ammo to town, plowing over any Zeds that get in his way. May Hauser supports heroes by conserving ammo and lending her marksmanship and aid to the cause. General Lee, the Hauser's well-trained thoroughbred, races across Farmingdale and assists heroes in need while charging through dangers. The Check Mates are a new Heroic Civilians lonely-hearts game club whose strength increases with Refugees in the camp!

—description from the publisher

Name: Dawn of the Zeds (Third Edition): Expansion Pack #2 – New Player Blues Expansion
Description:
The second Dawn of the Zeds: Third Edition Expansion Pack features 13 new Outbreak! (blue) Level Event and Fate cards, broadening the narrative and gameplay excitement. Zeds are learning to move in new and unexpected ways, catching the citizens of Farmingdale unaware and, at times, unprepared. Panic, confusion, and arguments only help the Zeds' cause, so it is important that citizens stick together during these dark times.

In addition, a new hero has arrived. No one knows what “Bouncing” Betty Bolivar is fighting for, but what they do know is the single-minded destruction she is capable of. With a personal vendetta against the Zeds, she charges in with nothing but her fists and determination.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dawn of the Zeds (Third Edition): Expansion Pack #3 – Rumors and Rails
Description:
The third Dawn of the Zeds: Third Edition Expansion Pack features two new game systems. In the first, Refugees are more helpful than ever â€‹as they bring â€‹with them Rumors about incrediblâ€‹y usefulâ€‹ items â€‹forâ€‹ the ongoing battleâ€‹.â€‹ â€‹All 16 â€‹Rumor chits provide heroes with special goodies or abilities â€‹when discovered. â€‹
The second game system features two trains operating â€‹fromâ€‹ â€‹the town's rail junction, providingâ€‹ heroes with new modes of transportationâ€‹ and unique strategic pieces on the chessboard at the Battle for Farmingdaleâ€‹.

—description from the publisher

Name: Trivia Board Game Agatha Christie
Description: Test your knowledge in this trivia board game with hundreds of questions about Britain's favourite mystery writer...Agatha Christie.

Name: Little Arrow
Description:
The forest is full of danger and treasure: close your eyes, jump, turn around and throw the arrow... Become the best archer and hit the best target, with your eyes closed!
Place the board in the middle of the table and randomly place on it the 8 target shapes. The player stands in front of the board and rolls the special dice. The results will determine the way to shoot the arrow: turn around 360 degrees, take a step backwards and one step forward, jump 3 times on the spot, take a step to the right and a step to the left, stand on a foot, etc. Then, he takes the arrow, closes his eyes, raises it up and performs the action indicated by the dice while placing it on the board (eyes closed!).
What did you hit?
The castle: you conquer the castle card, even if another player already conquered it.
A target: you conquer the target you hit.
A score area of the board: you conquer a treasure tile of the corresponding value (if some are still available).
The river: you don't conquer anything.
The swamp: you have to discard one of the tiles you previously won.
The game ends after the sixth turn terminates. Each player places the tiles and targets conquered during the match in a straight sequence: the player who forms the longest sequence wins.

Name: Conspiracy!: Bigfoot/Patterson-Gimlin Film Promo Cards
Description:
Set of 6 cards (1 Patterson-Gimlin Film & 5 Bigfoot) that can replace one set of conspiracy cards in the game.

Each conspiracy has different abilities in game.

Given out at conventions

Name: The World of the Horse
Description: The world of the horse board game features 2,200 questions and a selection of answers related to horses. For example: 'What is a horse with a black coat called?' A) Grey, B) Dun or C) Dark ? One of many questions on the always topical subject of the horse. There is a selection of three answers for each question. The players move their pieces across the board and receive a chip for every correct answer. Who will be the first to collect all of the eight different colored chips?

Name: Master Debaters: Smosh Edition
Description:
Here, at Master Debaters, we want you to debate the most pressing issues facing our country. We need answers to things like: Is a spork more spoon or more fork, are full denim outfits acceptable, and who would win in a fight between my dad and your dad? Battle head to head with your friends in front of a judge and jury to settle these, and other extremely important issues once and for all!

Straight from the internet's most popular comedy brand, this SMOSH Edition comes jam-packed with extra helpings of extraordinary and bizarre debate topics bound to get you and your friends into a game of sticky situations.

Master Debaters SMOSH edition is designed for players 12 and up, will have you arguing over crazy topics with your friends. Don't worry, because a judge and jury will help settle extremely important issues like "what's more salady: fruit salad or potato salad. The object of the game is to collect the most Master Debater cards by winning debates over your opponents. Each player is given a number card and a jury sheet. Each debate will have a judge, two debaters, and the rest of the players in the round become the jury. The judge chooses the debaters by picking numbers chosen by each player, The judge then reads the question and the debaters flip the chip to see whether they will argue point 1 or 2 on the topic card Each debater is given time for an opening statement, and then the opening argument begins. The timings can be 30 seconds or 10 seconds. The judge has final call on who wins and can override the jury decision.

—user summary

Name: Flamme Rouge: Le Grand Tour 2018
Description:
Promotional cards that were offered by Gigamic in France before the start of the Tour de France 2018.

There are 12 cards, including 21 track designs on alternating card sides. The designs represent the last 70 km of the actual stages raced in the Tour 2018 using the Flamme Rouge terrain system.

The geeklist with these original designs (and team time trial rules for stage 3):
https://boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/239543/flamme-rouge-tour-de-france-2018

-description from designer, Ryan Keane

Name: Chariots of Rome: Add-on Pack
Description:
Only the whims of the Gods and the skill of the aurigae will determine who the victor will be!

Putting the "Maximus" in your Circus Maximus, the Add-On Pack adds:

2 new teams of Chariots (Gold and Purple), each with a complete set of Faction mats, sets of tokens, initiative cards, standees, and flats

4 new Charioteers (Acacious, the vengeful; Marcellus, master auriga; Telesphoros, favored of the gods; Vitellius, brilliant tactician)

6 new Fate cards (Cerberus Unleashed; The Corrupt Wager; Cult of Mithras; Mars Inspires; Saturn's Intrigue; Theatrics for Bachus)

2 new Lap markers (Egg and Dolphin) to keep track of laps as they did in Circus Maximus

With this expansion you can now play with up to 12 charioteers.

Name: GourmetSmarts (Second Edition)
Description:
A trivia game with 100 question-and-answer cards covering four categories (Lingo, Ingredients, Cuisines, and Wild Card) related to food and fine dining.  A score pad tracks the progress of from 2 to 12 players.  The winner is the first to answer three questions correctly in each of the four categories, or the first to get a total of 12 questions correct.

Additional question-and-answer cards for the second edition were written by S. J. Allison.

Name: Necromagis
Description:
Theme
A fantasy post-apocalyptic horror game set in the fantasy world of Dalore. Players take on the role of Necromancers battling for whats left of the living to consume, enslave or corrupt.

Game-Play
A 2-4 player card game where players take it in turns to unearth zombies, feed them to level them up and then attack. You can also cast spells and defend yourself with magical gear cards.

Goal
The winner is determined by last man standing. Players will be eliminated from the game the moment they have no cards left in their deck.

—description from the designer

Name: Exceed: Emogine Solo Fighter
Description:
This box contains one complete Fighter for Exceed from the world of Seventh Cross.

Emogine utilizes holy magic to drive back opponents, praying for divine guidance and relying on luck to carry her through. Able to subtly influence her own fate, her defensive abilities provide excellent suitability.

—description from the publisher

Name: Exceed: Sydney & Serena Solo Fighter
Description:
This box contains one complete Fighter for Exceed from the world of Seventh Cross.

Sydney fights alongside his plant companion, Serena, who has an insatiable thirst for human blood. These two form a unique new take on puppet-fighters, with Serena eventually uprooting herself and taking over the fight!

—description from the publisher

Name: Exceed: Carl Swangee Solo Fighter
Description:
This box contains one complete Fighter for Exceed.

Carl joins the fight from the world of Penny Arcade’s Automata webcomic. Utilizing a powerful new Overload mechanic, Carl can strike with inhuman strength and speed. This well-rounded normal-focused fighter offers a whole new style of play!

—description from the publisher

Name: Exceed: Pooky Solo Fighter
Description:
This box contains one complete Fighter for Exceed.

Pooky takes a break from the excitement of Red Dragon Inn to join the battle in Exceed!

The Good: With wild magic and extreme mobility on his side, Pooky can surprise opponents and get the upper hand in nearly any situation.

The Bad: Umm... do those teeth look bigger than they were a moment ago?

—description from the publisher

Name: Exceed: Shovel Knight Solo Fighter
Description:
This box contains one complete Fighter for Exceed.

For Shovelry! The eponymous Shovel Knight joins the fight, bringing with him a wide array of relics that will allow him to bury the competition! Unearth all-new skills and tactics with this fighter!

—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Star Players Card Pack
Description:
A splendid deck of 24 cards covering all the Star Players from Death Zone Seasons 1 & 2, as well as the Blood Bowl boxed game – this is a treat for all sports fans. Each reference card features handsome (well… mostly handsome) artwork, along with the player’s name, race, statline, skills and a list of the teams they’re willing to play for. For a price (which is also listed on the card, handily!)

The Players:

Barik Farblast
Bo Gallanté
Eldril Sidewinder
Glart Smashrip
Griff Oberwald
Grim Ironjaw
Guffle Pusmaw
Hakflem Skuttlespike
Helmut Wulf
Horkon Heartripper
Jordell Freshbreeze
Karla Von Kill
Kreek Rustgouger
Mighty Zug
Morg 'n' Thorg
Madcap Miggz
Prince Moranion
Ripper Bolgrot
Roxanna Darknail
Scrappa Sorehead
Lucien Swift
Valen Swift
Varag Ghoul-Chewer
Willow Rosebark

-Description from the publisher

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – Shattered Aeons: Mythos Pack
Description:
Shattered Aeons is the sixth and final Mythos Pack in The Forgotten Age cycle for Arkham Horror: The Card Game.

In [gameid=245815 The Forgotten Age, you journeyed to the darkest corners of Central America in search of a lost Aztec city-state. What you found during your expedition may be the greatest scientific discover of the age, but it could also be the Earth's undoing.

Throughout The Forgotten Age cycle, you have tried to set your mistakes to right, chasing answers about the mysterious artifact your uncovered and those who pursue it. Retracing your path south, you have uncovered secrets that threaten your entire understanding of the world, of time, and of humanity's place in the universe. Now, the last and greatest of your questions will be answered in Shattered Aeons. But be wary as mere mortals may not be meant to gain such knowledge and the truths you seek may destroy what little remains of your sanity.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: #no secrets
Description:
In #no secrets, players must answer one of two questions with "yes" or "no". Which question you have to answer, depends on the hidden team card you got. Players must then analyze the answers to find one of their team members. You score points if you guess right. Whoever has the most points after three rounds wins.

—description from the publisher

•••

Bei #no secrets beantworten Spieler eine von zwei Fragen mit "Ja" oder "Nein". Welche Frage sie beantworten, geben Teamkarten vor, die zunächst geheim sind. Spieler wollen anhand der Antworten ihre Teammitglieder finden.

—description from the publisher (German)

Name: Exceed: Devris Solo Fighter
Description:
This box contains one complete Fighter for the Exceed Fighting System Card Game. Devris, an apprentice Warlock from the world of Mage Wars, invokes blood pacts and dark powers to overcome his foes.

—description from the publisher

Name: Exceed: Juno Solo Fighter
Description:
This box contains one complete Fighter for the Exceed Fighting System Card Game. Juno, a DJ from the pop-future world of Esper X, uses music as her weapon as she fights to change the future of her world.

—description from the publisher

Name: Exceed: Skull Man Solo Fighter
Description:
This box contains one complete Fighter for the Exceed Fighting System Card Game. Super Skull Man 33 has a unique ability to bring comic book powers to life by mimicking sounds. Now he uses this power to fight crime!

—description from the publisher

Name: Psycho Loco
Description:
Psycho Loco is a strategic card game for 2-5 players.

Players bet on how many of their cards they can match to the target Psycho Dice over five rounds. The winner of each round acquires all wagered Betting Bones as well as an all important Skull Token.

The player with the fewest Skull Tokens at the end of the game must risk the pain of eating a Russian Roulette Chocolate Bullet, some of which are plain 'blank rounds' and some of which are 'live rounds' laced with enough chilli heat to melt your face off.

—user summary

Name: Arcadia Quest: Riders – Mount Pack 1: Stonebeak & Phantom
Description: Exclusive Kickstarter mount pack containing the Stonebeak and Phantom figures and their mount cards.

Name: Awkward Arms & Armor
Description:
An (im)mature party game that blends judging the funniest submission with lightweight dungeon crawling.

Each round, one player is the combatant and faces off against a monster. Everyone else crafts weapons using a combination a prefix, a weapon, and a suffix card, placing them face down. The combatant reads the items aloud, selects one that he or she finds the most humorous, and selects one to use for battle. Battle outcomes are determined by rolling a number of custom targeting dice.

Points are earned for defeating monsters as the combatant, creating weapons that are used to defeat monsters, and by creating the most humorous weapons in any given round. Points can be lost by losing to monsters and by defeating adorable creatures worth negative points.

The first player to a pre-determined number of points wins!

Name: Clank! Expeditions: Gold and Silk
Description:
If you have an insatiable thirst for plunder, Clank! Expeditions: Gold and Silk is for you: a series of boards to continue your deck-building adventures.

This first expedition begins in a mine abandoned by the Ruin Dwarven Mining Company (Ruin DMC) when it became infested with monsters. But it still holds plenty of gold for those daring enough to enter.

Still more wealth awaits in the Spider Queen's Lair. Surely the Spider Queen herself is just a legend meant to scare people away from such a fancy castle…

This expansion requires Clank! A Deck-Building Adventure to play.

—description from publisher

Name: Captain Underpants and the Rip-Roaring Race to Remain Rainless Game
Description:
It's up to you to save the day with George, Harold, and Captain Underpants! Players work together to get through the toilet paper obstacle course. Keep Captain Underpants from getting wet and changing into Principal Krupp! Watch out for Professor Poopypants, Turbo Toilet 2000, and other twists and turns! This game uses good old fashioned tap water to add to the fun!
—description from the publisher

The game involves each player moving according to a spinner. Within the track, there are spaces which require the player who lands on them to transfer water from one cup (which starts full) to a smaller cup (which starts empty). If the water spills from the smaller container, all players lose. If all players make it to the end before the smaller cup fills up, the game is a victory for the players. Graphics ties the gameplay to the cartoon characters.
—user summary

Name: Dungeon Alliance: Champions
Description:
Dungeon Alliance: Champions is the first expansion to the Dungeon Alliance deck-building miniatures adventure game.

This expansion adds the following new materials to the game:

1) New Heroes & Upgrades: The expansion includes 4 new heroes, including each character’s Hero Card, Hero Figure, and 3 Starting Deck Cards. The expansion also includes 8 new Upgrade Cards.

2) Deck of Many Treasures: The Deck of Many Treasures is a separate deck of cards that provides potential rewards for players willing to "dig deeper" into Treasure Chests and Locked Chests that they have opened.

3) Hero Selection Tokens: Hero Selection Tokens provide an easier way to select random heroes targeted by Final Enemies and their minions.

4) Deep Dungeon Final Enemy Room: The Deep Dungeon Final Enemy Room allows players to confront Final Enemies in a more climactic fashion. Heroes who find a quest entrance now open the way to the Final Enemy’s deadly lair filled with additional minions and traps.

5) Final Enemy Room Cards: Deep Dungeon Final Enemy Room Cards provide additional challenges for players who venture into the enemy’s lair, including vicious minions and debilitating traps.

6) Titan Room: The Realm of the Titan provides a godlike Final Enemy for players who play in Campaign Mode.

Name: Kofre's Curse
Description:
Kofre’s Curse is a treasure hunting game where you and your friends work cooperatively to excavate a pyramid. The pyramid contains 25 chambers that either contain traps, treasures or monsters. Each character in the game has unique skills that allow them to pass through some trials without much struggle while having to exert themselves in other areas. Unique skills include Strength, Sanity, Speed and Sanity. Use your muscles to plow through leagues of mummies! Use magic to break curses and go head to head with magical foes!

Gameplay: In Kofre’s Curse you build a pyramid using chamber tiles you as you see in the picture's below. Every player starts in the entrance and on each person’s turn they draw a tile and complete the task on the tile. When the 25 tiles are laid down a boss will emerge from the tomb and all the players will work cooperatively to beat him or her. Players will win and take the treasure home or forever lay buried within the tomb!

—description from the publisher

Name: Sum Fun
Description:
Use the tiles you have picked up to make SUMs. Once all of the tiles are out, the winner is the first person to use all of their tiles to make valid SUMs. Everybody plays the game at the same time, there is no waiting around for another player to take their turn as each person makes their own SUMs independently from one another.

SUM FUN comes in a handy blue zip-up canvas case, meaning it’s easy to take anywhere, whether it be in a class room, a living room, or a picnic table! The case contains the following: 103 white ‘number’ tiles (10 sets of 0-9 and 3 joker tiles), 87 blue ‘symbol’ tiles (35 equals, 18 plus, 18 minus, 7 multiply, 7 divide and 2 joker tiles) and Instructions (English, French, German, Italian, Spanish)

(Basically Bananagrams with number and mathematical operator tiles instead of letters.)

Name: Game of Suspicion
Description: In Game of Suspicion, players try to guess the exact number of other players' hands, preventing other players from guessing the exact number of theirs. Once all the players' hands are successfully guessed by other players, that player is eliminated from the game. The player who has guessed right scores points according to the number of the cards. (i.e., if that player has four cards, and you guess them correctly, you get 4 points). The player with 15 or more points wins.

Name: Miremarsh: The Undermire
Description:
The Undermire. A grim place deep underneath the swampy marsh. This  Kickstarter Exclusive board allows you to explore the depths of Miremarsh in all new locations, battling those creatures who dwell in the darkness. Its layout expands the world of Miremarsh, adding to the replayability and overall fun.

New weird and wonderful locations have been added to the Undermire Expansion, with exciting places and new dangers opened up to the exploring Goblins. Plus the Undermire comes with it's own Unique Quest - The Undying King!

Watch out for those pesky Ghost Goblins floating through the swamp looking to annoy and hinder your progress. 12 exclusive Ghost Goblin Miniatures in translucent plastic.  The new environment also brings new quests and ways to become king! And of course, with new locations comes new dangers. 4 monster tiles have been added to the Undermarsh Expansion, each looking for some little Goblins to feast upon.

Name: Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Settlement Deck
Description:
Fallout: Wasteland Warfare – Settlement Deck contains 119 cards consisting of Weapons, Equipment, Mods, Chems, Power Armour, Boosts, Quests, Perks, Leaders and Explore cards.

The Settlement Deck contains the T51 and T45 power armour as well as the plain power armour frame.

Name: Dojo Sensei
Description:
Dojo Sensei is a worker placement game set in the future on a fictional Japanese island called Meiyoshima. In this game, you are a sensei opening a new dojo, trying to make a name for yourself and your school.

In Dojo Sensei, you will make decisions that will customize your dojo, your fighters, and your students. You will carve a path to victory and honor by training students, turning fighters into warriors, putting on demonstrations of your skill, constructing and remodeling your dojo how you see fit, investing in different martial arts styles, competing in various martial arts competitions, and of course proving yourself in the Kumite!

Players are in control of 3 different types of workers - Sensei, Trainers, and Champions that will be placed on the main board and in their dojo.  The Sensei is a trainer that you can customize with bonuses or even break the rules.  The trainers are the majority of your workers and they will build your dojo and train your champions.  Champions are workers that are placed in competitions - forms, breaking, and weapons - that when resolved, will earn you victory points.  You can add more trainers and more champions to your dojo, but you will first have to start training them as students in your dojo.

Tableau
     Champions - players are able to customize up to three champions.  Their basic stats - Strength, Finesse, and Mastery.  As well as use trainers, to give their champions new maneuvers.  These maneuvers are the deck-bulding / card management of the game.
     Dojo - your Dojo is a player board that you will customize by placing different shaped tiles on it, that will slowly bring your dojo to life.  These tiles will give you actions and bonuses in the game.  Here you can decide if you want to focus on income, on building strong champions, on performances, on specific competitions, and many more.

Every play of Dojo Sensei will be different.  The goals you are reaching for to end the game will change, the tiles available to build your dojo will be different every turn.  The maneuvers that are available in the temples to train your champions will be different. In order to win you will need to both focus on how you will bring honor to your dojo, but also be flexible enough to react to your opponents and the conditions on the main board.
